text.__SUMMARY__: Common names: Kenyan carpet viper, Leakey's saw-scaled viper.Echis pyramidum leakeyi is a venomous viper subspecies endemic to northern East Africa.
text.Etymology: The specific name, leakeyi, is in honor of Kenyan herpetologist J.H.E. Leakey.
text.Geographic range: E. p. leakeyi is found in southwestern Ethiopia (Lake Stephanie), northwestern Kenya, and southern Somalia.The type locality is "Nord-Kenya, West-Ufer des Baringo-Sees, Campi ya Samaki, ca. 1000 m. H" (= North Kenya, west bank of Lake Baringo, Camp ya Samaka, ca. 3,300 ft).
